channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-18595] UNIX_TIMESTAMP UDF fails when type is Timestamp with local timezone
item.description:
2018-01-31T12:59:45,464 ERROR [10e97c86-7f90-406b-a8fa-38be5d3529cc main] ql.Driver: FAILED: SemanticException [Error 10014]: Line 3:456 Wrong arguments ''yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss'': The function UNIX_TIMESTAMP takes only string/date/timestamp types
org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.parse.SemanticException: Line 3:456 Wrong arguments ''yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss'': The function UNIX_TIMESTAMP takes only string/date/timestamp types

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12910938 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
In GenericUDFDateDiff is there a reason to do new Date() on every call? date.set() was avoiding extra allocation and gc.
ashutoshc the new Date() was part of this method org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.udf.generic.GenericUDFDateDiff#convertToDate  anyway. Am i missing somthing ?

* - date.setTime(formatter.parse(dateString).getTime());
 * + return new Date(formatter.parse(dateString).getTime());

I am talking couple of changes like this which patch is bringing in.
This jira is resolved and released with Hive 3.0 If you find an issue with it, please create a new jira.
